result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron K Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 8 years bifurcated sentence.

STAYED
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Defendant to undergo a mental health assessment and follow recommendations. Counseling, treatment, services including Cognitive Thinking program. Defendant may not change residence without Agent's approval. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant may participate in the Behavior Health Services in-jail program. 
Defendant may serve in Kenosha County Jail - and participate in the Birds of a Feather program. 
Huber for work and treatment granted.
Defendant may not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances, absolute sobriety is required.     AMENDED 05-22-2015:  Upon completion of jail AODA program, balance of jail time stayed.  Defendant must complete all recommended Continuing Care under the supervision of DOC.

Restitution request - provided by Victim Witness. VI-JP   No amount given - victim information only. Discuss case, notice of all court hearings (mail), disposition of the case.
PLUS $10,000 co-sig
Status conference on October 24th, 2014 at 9:30 am.

PLUS $10,000 CO-SIGNED BY MOTHER, JAMI GLASER dob 10-11-1977 and FATHER, PHILLIP PETERS dob 8-18-1977. No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family) or co-defendants. Defendant must live w/mother and follow all her rules. May attend scholl and can be employed. 6pm Curfew - may be modified by mother. When out of the home it must be w/permission of mother and she must know where he is at all times. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances, unless prescribed.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) once released - to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building), however testing may be done in Kenosha. The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

When out of home, must be w/permission of mother and she must know where he is at all times. No cs unless prescribed - reg w/ZCI however testing can be done in Kenosha.
